content.description: Stand start on right side of large overhang, left hand on slot or quartz crimp, right hand on lip. Pull on and cruise lip left until it's natural end, transition onto face holds. Use power and trickery to make longer move to peak and make thought provoking mantle.
content.location: Downhill from Batshit is this obvious overhanging face.

content.description:
Starting as far left as you can on the face (left hand on arete, right on rail feature), move right along face rail before powerful move to join start of Croc Block Left.

 Using/riding the lip to traverse to the summit is an alternate at a much easier grade.
content.location: Left side of obvious overhanging face downhill from Batshit.

content.description: Just left of peak, find 2 flakey crimps at face height. Pull through these straight up to more questionable flakes and the to the lip before making committed mantle.
content.location: Below Batshit, on mid-left side of obvious overhanging face.

content.description:
Start deep under roof on large jug. Climb out on small holds and techy feet to face and exit straight up dihedral.

 Start on jug on far face and traverse into original start to experience the full length of the roof.
content.location: Below Breakaway and uphill from Croc Block

content.description: Start on the pedestal to the right of Bat Shit Crack.  Pull around onto the slab and reach past the roof to the finish jug.  Drop off or traverse right from here

Start under the roof on big obvious jug. Work your way out to the lip with some cool foot work. When you make it to the lip, rather than going straight up the dihedral, move out to a crimp rail on the left, then a big move to a huge jug on the tip of the prow. Drop off from here.
content.protection: couple of pads, watch the spikey rock on the left
content.location: Bad Shit Crack boulder, up hill from Croc Block

content.description: Starts under roof on large jug (same as Batshit Crack), but at face head right and make desperate mantle over refrigerator block feature.
Two bouldering areas further downhill from Breakway Wall, home to a few classic lines.
